item.title: Git Guide 101
item.description: Git Guide 101 Commit The “commit” command is used to save your changes to the local repository. Initialized a repository git init Add a file to the staging area git add --all Commit files git commit -m "message" git commit -am "message with adding file to the staging area " Repository log git log Repository status git status Unstag files git reset --hard git diff <1stVer commit hash> <LastVer commit hash> :: difference btw changes made Branch In Git, branches are a part of your everyday development process.

item.title: How Quick it is to edit a blog
item.description: Adding time format to the new post YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZZZ Remove module from .git folder ls -a cd .git cd modules/ rm -rf mdl-docs/

item.title: NODE JS
item.description: Node.js 101 Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform, JavaScript runtime environment that executes JavaScript code outside of a web browser. Node.js lets developers use JavaScript to write command line tools and for server-side scripting—running scripts server-side to produce dynamic web page content before the page is sent to the user’s web browser.

item.title: Socket.io Guide 101
item.description: Socket.io Socket.IO is JavaScript implementation to work with HTML 5 WebSockets. In can be used in NodeJS & based server frameworks for server-side, while client-side can be integrated with pure JavaScript, AngularJS, React.
